strings:
<se_low>Yangus: Ah, Pickham!
Me 'ometown!
It's good to be back!
<se_high>Jessica: I didn't know you had a place you thought of as home, Yangus.
<se_high>Jessica: I figured you were probably raised by baboons or something in the jungle. Heh heh!

<se_low>Yangus: Oi! Watch it!
Me parents weren't no animals, awright!<page>Yangus: Sure, me dad was a bit of a toad, but me mum was a decent bird<endash> ...I mean, a lady.
A bit of a fox, as it goes.

<se_high>Jessica: I thought the sailors in Port Prospect were a rough bunch.
But the people of Pickham put them to shame!
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose I should've expected Yangus's hometown would be a bit, er...shady.
<se_def>Angelo: What exactly are we doing in this dirty den, <hero>?
<se_def>Angelo: Who knows what we might catch?<page>Angelo: Let's go somewhere where they can at least pronounce ‘hygiene’ before we end up like the rest of the tramps here.
<se_low>Yangus: I was one 'ell of a thief back when I was livin' 'ere. A real top-class bandit.
<se_low>Yangus: But I got fed up wiv all that criminal stuff, so I decided to wash me 'ands of it an' leave Pickham for good.
<se_low>Yangus: Goddess, 'ow long's it been since I was last 'ere, I wonder? It feels funny bein' back, I can tell ya!

<se_high>Jessica: Life is full of surprises!
I never thought I'd actually visit a town like this.<page>Jessica: Pickham and the place I grew up in are like night and day.
<se_def>Angelo: This place is filthy.<page>Angelo: Let's find this information dealer, Brains, or whatever he's called, and bid farewell to this stench as quickly as we can.
<se_low>Yangus: Come to think of it, Brains did used to go off ev'ry now an' then to get the low-down on wot's goin' on in the world.
<se_low>Yangus: Talk about bad timin', eh, us comin' along just when 'e's off on one of 'is trips!
<se_low>Yangus: I didn't like the sound o' that noise, guv! Better follow Grandad an' see wot's goin' on.
<se_high>Jessica: His Majesty said he wanted to have a quiet drink, so I assume we'll find him in the pub.

<se_high>Jessica: Was that the Princess whinnying?
I've got a bad feeling about this.
<se_def>Angelo: I vote we pick up King Frog-face and kiss goodbye to this goddessforsaken dump right now.

<se_high>Jessica: Really?
I kind of want to explore around some more.

<se_def>Angelo: You're a strange lady, Jessica.
What kind of girl ENJOYS walking around a grimy, unrefined ghetto like this?

<se_def>Angelo: Ah, but that explains it!<page>Angelo: That's why you won't succumb to the advances of a clean-cut, dapper young bachelor like myself!
It all makes so much sense.

<se_high>Jessica: Oh, bravo, Angelo!
A positively SPLENDID analysis!<page>Jessica: Hey, <hero>!
What do you say we ignore Lord Snooty here and start looking for King Trode ourselves?

<se_def>Angelo: If Brains is out of town, we don't need to stay here any longer, do we?
Time to move on!
<se_def>Angelo: Our esteemed King seems to have drunk a little too much.

<se_def>Angelo: He wasn't looking too steady on his feet.
Perhaps we'd better make sure he's all right.

<se_low>Yangus: I must be losin' it!
No one would ever 'ave got away wiv pinchin' an 'orse from under me nose back in the old days.<page>Yangus: I might've pinched one from under someone else's, mind! Heh heh!
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder who stole the Princess... And why?

<se_high>Jessica: What if it was Dhoulmagus!?
Do you think he's behind this?
We'd better hurry up and find her!

<se_def>Angelo: I warned you! I've been saying we should leave this place from the moment we arrived!
We're in this mess because we stayed too long.
<se_low>King Trode: We don't have time for idle chit-chat! My precious Medea has been kidnapped!

<se_low>King Trode: Oh, my poor Medea!
What terrible fate has befallen you!?

<se_low>King Trode: Stop dallying, <hero>!
Find my Medea at once!

<se_low>Yangus: Dodgy Dave, eh?
I used to do a fair bit o' business wiv 'im back in the old days.

<se_low>Yangus: It's funny, ain't it?
I never thought I'd be goin' back to 'is shop.
Not for somefin' like this, that's for sure!

<se_high>Jessica: She's been sold on the black market?
Already!? She was only stolen a few minutes ago!
Wow, you really DO have to watch out in this town!
<se_high>Jessica: I think I finally understand why they call this place the ‘home of impropriety, crime and vulgarity!’
<se_def>Angelo: A thousand gold coins for the horse AND the cart!? That thief was robbed! He could've got double that!

<se_low>King Trode: We don't have time for idle chit-chat!
My precious Medea has been SOLD!

<se_low>King Trode: Oh, my poor Medea!
What terrible fate has befallen you!?

<se_low>King Trode: Stop dallying, <hero>!
We must go to this black market merchant's shop!

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, nah, nah, nah...
I don't want anyfin' more to do wiv Red!
I wish we didn't 'ave to go an' see 'er.
<se_low>Yangus: But I s'pose this ain't no time to be moanin'. The 'orse-princess is in trouble an' all.

<se_low>Yangus: Ya know where 'er place is, right?
In the middle o' that lake southwest of 'ere.
She lives on a little island there.
<se_low>Yangus: We can't 'ang around 'ere in Pickham too long.
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta get 'old o' the Venus' tear an' take it to Red. Just think o' the 'orse-princess. It<endash> ...I mean, she, must be in a right state!
<se_high>Jessica: It sounds like Yangus has known Red for a long time. Is she his ex-girlfriend or something?
<se_high>Jessica: No way! She can't be!
<se_high>Jessica: We're going to have to explore a cave to find that jewel, you know, so don't forget to stock up on supplies before we leave.

<se_def>Angelo: What a colossal waste of time!
We've got bigger fish to fry!

<se_def>Angelo: Let's just forget about the Princess.
I can't be bothered with her.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Oh, come on! I'm only joking!
Don't look so horrified!
<se_def>Angelo: I thought we were supposed to be going to the cave where the Venus' tear's hidden, no?
<se_def>Angelo: Or were you thinking of trying your luck at the casino first? I like your style!

<se_low>King Trode: Have you taken leave of your senses!?
Pull yourself together and find my Medea at once!
<se_low>King Trode: We need to leave town and find this lady-bandit, Red!
<se_low>King Trode: Stop dallying and focus on the task at hand! Wouldn't you agree that we have more important things to be doing than chatting?

<se_low>King Trode: <Cap><hero>!
I'm beginning to think you're deliberately trying to provoke me!
<se_low>Yangus: I thought it'd 'elp comin' 'ere...
<se_low>Yangus: But Brains ain't around, the 'orse-princess 'as been kidnapped, an' ev'ryfin's goin' wrong.
<se_low>Yangus: Now I know wot visitors who came to Pickham when I was up to me old tricks must've felt like!
<se_high>Jessica: Is there any particular reason why we came back here!? We're so close to getting the Princess back!
<se_high>Jessica: Wait, don't tell me. You're trying to figure out how much you can sell the Venus' tear for, right? You're unbelievable!

<se_def>Angelo: There's no time to mess about now.
We've got to pay Red a visit.
<se_def>Angelo: Just being in this town makes me shudder, anyway.
<se_low>King Trode: Now all we have to do is take the stone to that lady-bandit and exchange it for my Medea!
<se_low>King Trode: I don't care if it's the Venus' tear or the contents of the Trodain royal vault!<page>King Trode: My precious Medea is worth a million of either, and more besides!
<se_low>Yangus: I wish Brains would 'urry up an' come back!

<se_high>Jessica: Yangus's right.
Talking to him is the whole reason we came to Pickham.
<se_high>Jessica: What with the Princess getting kidnapped, it completely slipped my mind!
<se_high>Jessica: It would be incredibly stupid if we missed our chance to see Brains.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if he's even going to be able to give us any information about Dhoulmagus anyway.

<se_low>Yangus: You don't need to worry about that.
Trust me, no one knows more about wot's goin' on than Brains!
<se_def>Angelo: Well, we'll see. I'm not holding my breath. But I suppose we should pay the man a visit, just in case.
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like it's time to say goodbye to Pickham, then. But I'll be back 'ome some time soon, wiv a bit o' luck.

<se_high>Jessica: What's wrong?
What are you waiting for?
Let's go and see Brains now!
<se_high>Jessica: So, according to Brains...<page>Jessica: ...we've got to follow the coastline west from Port Prospect, and we'll come across a ship abandoned in the middle of the wasteland. Right?
<se_high>Jessica: I remember the path there was blocked by a rockslide before. I wonder if they've finished clearing it?

<se_def>Angelo: This town and me don't mix.
We can't leave quickly enough, as far as I'm concerned.
<se_def>Angelo: A magical ship in the middle of some wasteland!? Doesn't it all sound a bit far-fetched to you? I wouldn't take this fellow too seriously.
<se_def>Angelo: If you ask me, he's just feeding us rubbish to get us off his back.
<se_low>Yangus: Are you a bit of a gambler then, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Nice! I shoulda known you'd be good at that kind o' thing. I'm 'opeless at it meself. All them numbers an' that. Goes right over me 'ead.

<se_low>Yangus: But you could teach me, guv!
How about you give me a few pointers, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: Me neither.
I ain't too good wiv all that fiddly stuff.
I lose a packet whenever I gamble.<page>Yangus: Nah, I always preferred the safe route meself.
There's more dough in them! Hah hah hah!
Er, not no more o' course!
<se_high>Jessica: It's okay to gamble once in a while, but don't forget what we're fighting for!
<se_high>Jessica: So long as you always keep the true purpose of our journey in mind, you won't hear a peep out of me.
<se_def>Angelo: What, there's no poker here?

<se_def>Angelo: I was looking forward to introducing our very own Queen of Diamonds to the rest of the pack!<page>Angelo: You see, Jessica, you might have won with a good pair in the past, but you'll need more than that to beat my hand!
<se_high>Jessica: Like I'd lay my pair on your table anyway, you cheat!
<se_high>Jessica: And don't go getting up to any of your tricks, okay? You could get into serious trouble here.
<se_def>Angelo: Are you worried about me, darling?
<se_high>Jessica: No, I'm worried about all of us...honey!
<se_low>Yangus: Is it better to figure out the recipe first, before we go off on a wild-goose chase for the ingredients?

<se_low>Yangus: Or maybe we better get 'old o' the ingredients first, so we've got 'em when we figure out the recipe...<page>Yangus: Cor, I ain't used to thinkin' this 'ard!
Wot should we do?
<se_high>Jessica: Hm. Do you remember what we've been asked to work on?
<se_high>Jessica: Well, there's no harm in asking for a reminder if you've forgotten.
<se_def>Angelo: He said he was letting you in on a money-making scheme by way of apology, but it seems to me he's the one who's going to benefit the most.

<se_def>Angelo: You really can't trust the people here an inch, can you?<page>Angelo: What was it that man said about Pickham?
Home of impropriety, crime, and vulgarity?
It's certainly as advertised!

<se_low>Yangus: Hocus-pocus, diddle-de-doo!? Blakaza-wot?
Wot was it she said?

<se_low>Yangus: I dunno wot 'er fortune-tellin's like, but that spell sounded like the real deal awright.
Blakaza-fiddle-de-foo! Alaka...
<se_high>Jessica: I love getting a good bargain, but it's hard to trust a free fortune.

<se_high>Jessica: ...Oh! Sorry, <hero>!
You believe it, do you?
Just forget what I said, then.

<se_def>Angelo: The things she says could be true of anything or anyone!
It's a load of rubbish.

<se_def>Angelo: Mind you, so's all fortune-telling.
You'd have to be crazy to believe any of it.

<se_low>Yangus: Hocus-pocus, diddle-de-doo.
Blakaza-fiddle-de-foo! Alaka-wam!? Alaka<endash>
<se_low>Yangus: Ah! I almost remembered the lot of it then!
<se_high>Jessica: I love getting a good bargain, but it's hard to trust a free fortune.

<se_high>Jessica: ...Oh! Sorry, <hero>!
You believed it, did you?
Forget what I just said.

<se_def>Angelo: The things she says could be true of anything or anyone!
It's a load of rubbish.

<se_def>Angelo: Mind you, so's all fortune-telling.
You'd have to be crazy to believe any of it.
<se_low>Yangus: Brains'll know somefin' about Dhoulmagus for sure.
<se_low>Yangus: He'd better! Otherwise I'm gonna look like a prize lemon, ain't I? I mean, it was me wot brought us 'ere an' ev'ryfin'.
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like it's time to say goodbye to Pickham, then. But I'll be back 'ome some time soon, wiv a bit o' luck.
<se_high>Jessica: This house is so well-hidden!
<se_high>Jessica: Without Yangus, I never would've thought to look for Brains here.
<se_high>Jessica: So, according to Brains...<page>Jessica: ...we've got to follow the coastline west from Port Prospect, and we'll come across a ship abandoned in the middle of the wasteland. Right?

<se_high>Jessica: I remember the path there was blocked by a rockslide before.
I wonder if they've finished clearing it?
<se_def>Angelo: Thinking about it, this place must be next door to the casino, right?

<se_def>Angelo: This town's built like a maze!
Another good reason to detest the place!
<se_def>Angelo: A magical ship in the middle of some wasteland!? Doesn't it all sound a bit far-fetched to you? I wouldn't take this fellow too seriously.
<se_def>Angelo: If you ask me, he's just feeding us rubbish to get us off his back.
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: Erm...I don't think we've finished at Trodain Castle yet. Maybe we should leave the sightseeing tour for later.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library. It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says, you know.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if the Moonshadow harp is buried in some pile of junk in that alley...

<se_high>Jessica: I hope not! If it's sticky or smelly, I'm not touching it!
I don't care if it is a treasure!
<se_high>Jessica: Now that we know the Moonshadow harp is in Ascantha, there isn't any point in hanging around this cesspool!
<se_high>Jessica: Goodbye Pickham, hello Kingdom of Ascantha!

<se_low>Yangus: There's nuffin' Brains don't know.
Dodgy stuff or not. We should ask 'im.

<se_low>Yangus: I know Brains looks a bit lean an' that, but 'e's solid enough.
Trust me, ya can trust 'im.
<se_low>Yangus: He's 'elped me out in the past.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm in danger of inhaling something unpleasant if I open my mouth. I'd rather not talk.

<se_def>Angelo: Lady Luck must be smiling on us!
The King of Ascantha owes us a favour.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm sure he'll be happy to give us the Moonshadow harp.
<se_high>Jessica: Now that we know the Moonshadow harp is in Ascantha, there isn't any point in hanging around this cesspool!
<se_high>Jessica: Goodbye Pickham, hello Kingdom of Ascantha!

<se_low>Yangus: I know Brains looks a bit lean an' that, but 'e's solid enough.
Trust me, ya can trust 'im.
<se_low>Yangus: He's 'elped me out in the past.

<se_def>Angelo: Lady Luck must be smiling on us!
The King of Ascantha owes us a favour.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm sure he'll be happy to give us the Moonshadow harp.
<se_high>Jessica: I think that girl had better start looking for another line of work.
<se_low>Yangus: Brains is a lot more reliable than that bird.
<se_low>Yangus: Come on. Let's go!

<se_def>Angelo: Airy-fairy girls like her are always trouble.
...No, not in that way.
<se_def>Angelo: I don't remember anything like that harp in the abbey. So if it's not in this town, there's really only one place it can be, right?
<se_high>Jessica: Sounds like the thief who stole the Moonshadow harp is somewhere beyond that tunnel we saw in Ascantha Castle.
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!

<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'.
We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv.
Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.

<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character?
Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.
<se_high>Jessica: Like I said, she'd better start looking for a new line of work!
<se_low>Yangus: I thought that mole's song was gonna make me ears bleed, but now I can't stop 'ummin' it!
<se_def>Angelo: Well, we could drop by everyday if we've nothing better to do. Why not? You never know what kind of benefits there might be.
<se_high>Jessica: DUMMY LINE
<se_low>Yangus: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>Angelo: DUMMY LINE

<se_low>Yangus: Pickham's a diamond, ain't it?
You like the place too, eh guv?
That's great.

<se_low>Yangus: It's nice to see ya comin' back so often.
I thought I was the only one who enjoyed bein' 'ere!

<se_high>Jessica: So, what's the reason for coming to town this time?
The casino, or the black market?
<se_high>Jessica: I hope you're not forgetting the real purpose of our journey!
<se_def>Angelo: I'm fairly sure I've mentioned this before, but...I HATE THIS TOWN! I swear it's bad for my complexion, and LOOK AT MY HAIR!
<se_def>Angelo: Urgh! It's making me feel ill already!
<se_low>Yangus: It's a shame Grandad and that Charmless bloke can't see eye to eye.

<se_low>Yangus: I actually feel a bit sorry for the old codger.
Bet you never thought you'd see the day!
<se_high>Jessica: I set off on this journey to avenge my brother's death, and yet here I am babysitting this creep!

<se_def>Angelo: Poor Princess Medea.
Even if she's freed from this curse, she has to marry that awful Charmless.
<se_high>Jessica: If I were the Princess, I'd rather stay as a horse than marry that guy!
<se_low>Yangus: I've got it! We should find the Princess a nice 'orse-faced bloke wiv goofy teeth an' a long nose! It's the perfect solution!

<se_def>Angelo: How is that perfect!?
A horse can't marry a human, you idiot!
<se_def>Angelo: Ah, it's good to get away from Charmless for a while.

<se_def>Angelo: He's always lording it over us!
How's a man supposed to relax in these conditions!?
<se_low>Yangus: Well that was a bleedin' nightmare! Who'd 'ave thought that 'angin' out wiv royals would be this much of a pain!?
<se_high>Jessica: Once we've got the magic mirror from Argonia, we can finally get back to concentrating on Dhoulmagus again.

<se_def>Angelo: What a prize ass that Charmless is, getting on Medea's back like that!
Imagine if he knew she was his fiancée!
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose it's fair enough that he doesn't realise, though. A man doesn't expect his future bride to turn up in a bridle!
<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' after that Charmless was a right 'eadache. I almost forgot why we was doin' it for a while.
<se_low>Yangus: But we've got that magic mirror now, so we can finally get through to Dhoulmagus in the Dark Ruins.
<se_high>Jessica: We've had to take a few detours, but finally we can concentrate on Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: It's good that we managed to get the royal treasure at last, but the things that scholar was saying are a bit worrying.

<se_def>Angelo: All that talk about there being no magic in the mirror any more...
It doesn't look promising.
<se_def>Angelo: When you travel around so much like this, you end up with too many choices.
<se_high>Jessica: And what's that supposed to mean?
<se_def>Angelo: I mean it'll be hard to decide where to live once we've taken care of Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: You should all probably start thinking about what you're going to do once it's over too.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I've already got that sorted!
I'm gonna stick with the guv 'ere for good!
<se_high>Jessica: You really LOVE the GUV, huh!?
<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' after that Charmless was a right 'eadache. I almost forgot why we was doin' it for a while.
<se_low>Yangus: But we've got that magic mirror now, so we can finally get through to Dhoulmagus in the Dark Ruins.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a good job there's a way of gettin' magic back into the mirror, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Otherwise that prob'ly would've been the end of our journey.
<se_high>Jessica: We've had to take a few detours, but finally we can concentrate on Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: What a nuisance that there's only one spell that can restore the magic to the mirror!
<se_high>Jessica: Think how much easier it would be if one of my spells worked on it!
<se_def>Angelo: When you travel around so much like this, you end up with too many choices.
<se_high>Jessica: And what's that supposed to mean?
<se_def>Angelo: I mean it'll be hard to decide where to live once we've taken care of Dhoulmagus.
<se_def>Angelo: You should all probably start thinking about what you're going to do once it's over too.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I've already got that sorted!
I'm gonna stick with the guv 'ere for good!
<se_high>Jessica: You really LOVE the GUV, huh!?
<se_def>Angelo: It's good that we managed to get the royal treasure at last, but the things that scholar was saying are a bit worrying.

<se_def>Angelo: All that talk about there being no magic in the mirror any more...
It doesn't look promising.
<se_def>Angelo: How bizarre that the only thing that can return magic to the mirror is some kind of sea monster.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah. But at least ya know where you is wiv a monster, eh?
Not like babysittin' princes an' the like.
<se_high>Jessica: Who knows!?
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe this monster will be really ill and at death's door...

<se_high>Jessica: And it'll tell us we have to fetch the medicine to cure it before it casts the spell for us...<page>Jessica: ... but the medicine's ingredients are locked away in a dungeon guarded by a dragon, so we'll have to travel the world in search of the key...<page>Jessica: ... win a game of chess with a legendary pirate captain, get into some entertaining scrapes, defeat the dragon...<page>Jessica: ...and realise that the only thing we ever really needed was love...
AND THEN WHAT!?
<se_def>Angelo: Has anyone ever told you that you worry too much?
<se_def>Angelo: All we have to do is use the mirror to absorb a spell and then its magic will be restored.

<se_def>Angelo: I suppose not just any old spell will do?
Of course it couldn't possibly be that simple.

<se_low>Yangus: Let's get this out of the way sharpish, eh.
We don't 'ave time to faff about.
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't goin' 'ome 'til we've given Dhoulmagus the wot-for in the Dark Ruins, so we'll just 'ave to do wot it takes to get at 'im.
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo, are you going to leave the Templars when we've defeated Dhoulmagus?

<se_def>Angelo: That's the plan.
I don't want to be around my brother any more for one thing.
<se_def>Angelo: And the Abbot was my only real friend at the abbey. Once I've avenged his death, I won't have any more ties with the place.

<se_low>Yangus: Why d'you 'ate your brother so much, eh?
You've only got the one, after all.
Shouldn't you 'ave a bash at gettin' on?

<se_def>Angelo: It's him who hates me.
I don't have any feelings for him at all...
None whatsoever.

<se_high>Jessica: Let's hurry up back to the Dark Ruins.
Hopefully that mirror we spent so much effort getting hold of will take us to Dhoulmagus at last.
<se_def>Angelo: When we got the magic mirror in Argonia, I thought we were just a breath away from defeating Dhoulmagus.

<se_def>Angelo: But this should be the end of the distractions.
Now it's time to finish him off once and for all!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm well pleased that I could take you an' the old codger to Pickham on our travels!

<se_low>Yangus: I don't get why Angelo didn't take to the place.
Such a pity! Ha ha ha!
<se_high>Jessica: If Alistair lost to this guy, we should be ready for a tough fight!
<se_high>Jessica: We should make sure we're properly prepared before we go back to the Dark Ruins.
<se_def>Angelo: Jessica's a bit strange when you think about it. She's supposed to be a lady and yet here she is, hunting down her brother's killer!
<se_low>Yangus: She may be a lady by name, but she's from the sticks, ain't she? Just the same as the local yokels at the end o' the day!
<se_low>Yangus: Te he he he hee!

<se_high>Jessica: You've got a cheek talking about me like that!
And what's with the weird laugh anyway!?
<se_def>Angelo: I have to avenge the Abbot's death before I can properly draw a line under my life at the abbey.

<se_def>Angelo: When I first set off, I was under orders and nothing more.
But now I feel like this is my own duty.
<se_low>Yangus: D'you think Jessica went off because she don't like us, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe she got caught up in somefin' weird and got kidnapped!?

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I dunno! Listen to me goin' on!
I'm well confused!
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose it's a bit strange not having Jessica around. I'd almost go so far as to say I miss her. A bit.

<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, you're not the only one.
She's a brave one, that Jess.<page>Yangus: You can see it in 'ow she puffs 'er chest out, all proud, when she fights.
<se_def>Angelo: Oh, is that what that is? The first time I met her, I thought she must be hiding some water balloons in there.<page>Angelo: I feared for the dryness of my uniform, I can tell you!
<se_def>Angelo: We should ask after Jessica in Argonia rather than just wandering around aimlessly.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's ask first and look later.
<se_low>Yangus: Thinkin' of 'avin' a crack at the casino before we take on Rhapthorne, are ya?

<se_low>Yangus: Right. Good idea.
Bit of a warm-up, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: Thinkin' of 'avin' a crack at the casino before we take on Rhapthorne, are ya?

<se_low>Yangus: Right. Good idea.
Bit of a warm-up, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: It's a bit scummy, I know, but this town's me 'ome at the end o' the day. I ain't gonna let no one do nuffin' to wreck the place!

<se_low>Yangus: So come on!
Let's sort this Rhapthorne geezer out!
I'm all fired up now!

<se_high>Jessica: How can you gamble at a time like this!?
We're about to face Rhapthorne!
<se_high>Jessica: Whatever. We'll be risking it all when we take on Rhapthorne, so I suppose it can't hurt to practice keeping our cool when the stakes are high.

<se_high>Jessica: How can you gamble at a time like this!?

<se_high>Jessica: Whatever. We'll be risking it all when we take on Rhapthorne, so I suppose it can't hurt to practice keeping our cool when the stakes are high.

<se_high>Jessica: Pickham never changes.
For the residents of this little corner of the world, it seems to be business as usual!
<se_high>Jessica: Looks like the sky turning blood-red isn't enough to catch their attention.<page>Jessica: Are they thick-skinned, or just completely unaware of the world around them?
<se_def>Angelo: This casino's dull.

<se_def>Angelo: Where's the fun in slot machines and bingo?
If you want a buzz, you need to pit your wits against other people.
<se_def>Angelo: If it's a casino you want, let's go to Baccarat.

<se_def>Angelo: This place is dull.
Slot machines don't really get the adrenaline pumping, do they?
<se_def>Angelo: Pickham's the place for people who don't have anywhere else to go, right?

<se_def>Angelo: Hm? Am I looking for someone?
No, no. I was just...
<se_def>Angelo: Even if he has been knocked off his perch, he isn't the type to lay low in a place like this.

<se_high>Jessica: This time, Rhapthorne won't slip away. This time, I'm going to make him pay for what he did to my brother!
<se_high>Red: This place is as scummy as I remember. Watch yerself, <hero>. If you ain't careful, they'll 'ave the clothes off yer back 'ere!
<se_high>Red: Remember the golden rule in places like this: Look after number one.
<se_low>Morrie: Hm, some of the faces of the people here, I have seen before.

<se_low>Morrie: I remember them from the arena. I was
wondering why they stop coming in my pit,
but now I see. They have relocated to this
nook of the woods, ay?
<se_high>Red: Yer luck's in, is it? That's why yer 'ittin' the casino? ...Well if yer luck's in, shouldn't we be usin' it to see off Rhapthorne? Wot are ya gonna do if ya use it all up, eh?
<se_high>Red: Honestly, sometimes I think you ain't got a flamin' clue, <hero>, I really do!
<se_high>Red: Yer luck's in, is it? That's why yer 'ittin' the casino? ...Well if yer luck's in, shouldn't we be usin' it to see off Rhapthorne? Wot are ya gonna do if ya use it all up, eh?
<se_high>Red: Honestly, sometimes I think you ain't got a flamin' clue, <hero>, I really do!
<se_high>Red: This place is as scummy as I remember. It's spot on for the likes o' you, Yangus.
<se_high>Red: Mind you, I'll say this for Pick'am: I can remember a fair few times when people 'ere 'elped me out. So I s'pose I do sort of owe the place.
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha! Si, we try our luck before we go into battle, ay? You are a great leader, ragazzo, taking notice of the cycles of your banda's fortuna!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha! We try our luck before we go into battle, ay? But for the casino, my raccomandazione is Baccarat. The casino there is magnifico!
<se_low>Morrie: Wherever you are from, the hometown is the hometown, ay? No other place is gonna slice the mustard!

<se_low>Morrie: Allora, signor Yangus, you must be proud!
This is your roots, ay?
<se_high>Red: That Dodgy Dave's as sly as a fox if you ask me. But I s'pose we can risk givin' 'im the benefit o' the doubt, as long as we're gettin' compensated for wotever we make, right?
<se_high>Red: Might as well find out wot we're s'posed to be makin', eh?
<se_low>Morrie: Hm, taking the things you find as you travel and using the alchimia to change them into the things to sell to the people who are wanting them...
<se_low>Morrie: FANTASTICO! The true spirito of recycling! This man, he really cares about the world, ay?
<se_high>Red: Anyone who thinks there's any truth in fortune-tellin' don't 'ave no self-confidence, I reckon. That's why they gotta ask someone else if wot they're thinkin' o' doin's gonna fly.
<se_high>Red: I don't need none o' that. I'll make me own fortunes, thank you very much.
<se_low>Morrie: There is no free lunch in this world, ay? You want the good service, you gotta pay!
<se_low>Morrie: My Monster Arena is the same. Si, it is expensive to take part, but think of the THRILL you get from my monstrous pit!
